213501.name: Zuc!
213501.description:
Description from the publisher:

Zuc is a simple card game where you have to avoid being killed by the bombs in the deck. In your turn you must draw a card and show it to the other players. If it's a bomb, you lose. If it is not, you can keep the card and play any action card from your hand. Action cards are useful for making the other players drawing extra cards (more possibilities of drawing a bomb), skipping your own turn (and avoid drawing), shielding against the bombs and more similar actions.
Last player standing wins the game.

It's mostly about luck but still a very funny party game.

213502.name: My First Adventure
213502.description:
A Starter Adventure to Teach New Players

From the introduction:

The Knights of the North are in need of your aid! Word has reached your party that a band of Orcs has attacked their outpost and is holding them in a siege, slowly decimating their numbers. Rumor spoke of the Knights protecting an ancient relic that the Orcs may want to use in their continued assaults. The village you are in now does not have the resources to aid them, but you can. Travel due north at all speed, overcome whatever obstacles in your path and turn the tide in this battle!

A 6-hour adventure for 1st - 3rd level characters.

213503.name: The Brigade
213503.description:
Welcome to Tinderbox!
...sorry about the weather...
The city of Tinderbox has, rather predictably, caught fire.


Although no-one has formally admitted responsibility, a large fire storm has appeared above the Pyromancers University and fireballs are raining down on the city.

As such it’s a good time to be a firefighter, if being hero is your thing.

In The Brigade you control rival firehouses offering protection to the good citizens of Tinderbox. The aim of the game is to win the Loyalty of the people with acts of heroic fire fighting and earn the coveted position of Fire Chief.

The Brigade is an action point system game that allows players several different actions. Players must put out fires in order to gain loyalty, the more loyalty they have the more likely they are to become the fire chief. Players can also upgrade their firehouse, the amount of crew they can hire and their water wagon to put out stronger fires.

To win the loyalty of the people you must impress the enough that they will support you to become the Fire Chief, gaining the respect of 5 blocks or the same type, 5 blocks of different types will ensure your position. Alternatively, Earning respect from the highest and most prestigious people before one of the end game triggers will also get you that top spot.

213504.name: Conan: Vanir Valkyrie
213504.description:
"What manner of men are these northern folk?" asked Prospero.

"Tall and fair and blue-eyed. Their god is Ymir, the frost-giant, and each tribe has its own king. They are wayward and fierce. They fight all day and drink ale and roar their wild songs all night."

"Then I think you are like them," laughed Prospero. "You laugh greatly, drink deep and bellow good songs; though I never saw another Cimmerian who drank aught but water, or who ever laughed, or ever sang save to chant dismal dirges."

- Robert E. Howard, The Phoenix on the Sword

Contains:

1 Hero sheet (French and English on opposite sides)
4 Tiles (2 in French, 2 in English)
1 Plastic miniature

The Vanir Valkyrie is an additional playable hero.

KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE

213505.description:
"In the great square of the inner city, a sorcerer was being tortured, while a great mob looked on and jeered. Conan, attacked at his house by the monster, wounded it mortally and pursued it into the square, where it rushed to its master, the Kordafan, and fell dead. The frenzied mob tore the Kordafan to pieces…"

– Robert E. Howard, Appendices volume 2

The Overlord gains more of both swords and sorcery with the Kushite Witch Hunters. Its four distinctive miniatures, each of which comes with its corresponding unit tile, allow you to push the heroes to their limits with powerful spells and precision strikes.

As a powerful spell caster, the sorcerous Shubba can loose your vengeance upon the heroes with any spells you give him, and his concentration ability ensures that he'll never find his spell casting hindered by the heroes' interference.

Shubba's allies, Shafiah and Ghayoor, are skilled warriors whose attacks of two orange dice are deadlier than the heroes might expect. This is because they both have the precision strike ability which effectively allows their attacks to ignore the first point of a hero's armor. Meanwhile, their loyalty to the sorcerer is unquestionable, as both are willing to sacrifice themselves in his defense, if such a sacrifice should ever prove necessary.

The deadliest of the expansion's three melee warriors, Afari pairs his solid defense and brutal attack with the ability to counterattack. Whenever he faces one of the heroes' melee attacks, Afari can immediately retaliate by attacking with a single red die. While this attack isn't as powerful as a swing from his wicked blade, it still benefits from Afari's precision strike ability, and he can perform this counterattack multiple times in a turn—if the heroes are foolish enough to test themselves against his skills!

Components

4 Plastic miniatures (Bodyguard (Shafiah), Afari the warlord, Bodyguard (Ghayoor), Shubba the sorceror)
4 Game tiles (non-lingual)




Ageera appears in the Conan: Collectors Box.
213505.name: Conan: Kushite Witch Hunters

213508.name: Conan: Crossbowmen
213508.description:
The king and his allies moved westward at the head of fifty thousand men – knights in shining armor with their pennons streaming above their helmets, pikemen in steel caps and brigandines, crossbowmen in leather jerkins. They crossed the border, took a frontier castle and burned three mountain villages, and then, in the valley of the Valkia, ten miles west of the boundary line, they met the hosts of Conan, king of Aquilonia—forty-five thousand knights, archers and men-at-arms, the flower of Aquilonian strength and chivalry.

— Robert E. Howard, The Hour of the Dragon

Contains:

6 Tiles (3 in French, 3 in English)
10 Plastic miniatures

213509.name: The Celsius Agenda
213509.description:
(publisher blurb)

A stolen computer file of forbidden research plunges the travelers into a struggle against a deadly assassin with a frightening ability.

The Celsius Agenda is a no-frills adventure suitable for Cepheus Engine (or other tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic), starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

213510.name: The Xero Option
213510.description:
(publisher blurb)

To save a dying friend, the adventurers must wrest an illegal chemical from the cultists hoarding it.

The Xero Option is designed for Cepheus Engine (or other tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic, including the Classic Era Science Fiction Game), starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

213511.name: The Prometheus Index
213511.description:
(publisher blurb)

On a world run by geniuses where education is outlawed, the heroes are hired to steal a database of knowledge for distribution to the masses.

The Prometheus Index is a one-page, no-frills adventure for Cepheus Engine (or other science-fiction systems using 2D6 as a mechanic.) Designed as a one-shot, it can easily be slotted into an ongoing campaign.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC2 - County of Urnst Season Two
213512.name: Ogre Island
213512.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Crook of Rao was supposed to have banished all of Iuz's fiends from Oerth, but something has survived. Pray that your previous adventures have strengthened you to be able to deal with a growing threat before the Old One can unleash another army of demon-spawned monsters...

An adventure for characters level 3 - 8.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC2 - County of Urnst Season Two
213513.name: Deserted Dominion
213513.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Iuz and Redhand troops are amassing North of the Artonsamay River. Shouldn't the Countess's lands be a lot better defended?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 6.

213514.name: Conan: Baal-pteor
213514.description:
This man was naked except for a loin cloth and high-strapped sandals. He was brown-skinned, with close-cropped black hair and restless black eyes that set off a broad, arrogant face. In girth and breadth he was enormous, with huge limbs on which the great muscles swelled and rippled at each slightest movement. His hands were the largest Conan had ever seen. The assurance of gigantic physical strength colored his every action and inflection.

— Robert E. Howard, Shadows In Zamboula

Contains:

3 Tiles
1 Plastic miniature

KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE

213515.description:
The Black Dragons were on hand, wild with rage, swearing and ruffling, with their hands on their hilts and foreign oaths in their teeth.

"The guard is here, you old fool!" cavalierly snapped Pallantides, commander of the Black Dragons, forgetting Publius' rank in the stress of the moment. "Best stop your caterwauling and aid us to bind the king's wounds. He's like to bleed to death."

— Robert E. Howard, The Phoenix on the Sword

Contains:

2 Tiles (1 in French, 1 in English)
5 Plastic miniatures

KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE
213515.name: Conan: Black Dragons

213516.name: Conan: The Black Ones
213516.description:
However, he gave little heed to the wall at the time. His attention was centered on the band of beings that squatted about a dark green pool in the midst of the court. These creatures were black and naked, made like men, but the least of them, standing upright, would have towered head and shoulders above the tall pirate. They were rangy rather than massive, but were finely formed, with no suggestion of deformity or abnormality, save as their great height was abnormal. But even at that distance Conan sensed the basic diabolism of their features.

— Robert E. Howard, The Pool of the Black One

Contains:

6 Tiles (3 in French, 3 in English)
10 Plastic miniatures

213517.name: Conan: Sabertooth Tiger
213517.description:
The creature that stood in the gate was like the embodiment of nightmare legend. Its color was of a curious pale quality which made it seem ghostly and unreal in the dim light. But there was nothing unreal about the low-hung savage head, and the great curved fangs that glistened in the firelight. On noiseless padded feet it approached like a phantom out of the past. It was a survival of an older, grimmer age, the ogre of many an ancient legend—a saber-tooth tiger. No Hyborian hunter had looked upon one of those primordial brutes for centuries. Immemorial myths lent the creatures a supernatural quality, induced by their ghostly color and their fiendish ferocity.

— Robert E. Howard, Beyond the Black River

Contains:

2 Tiles (2 in French, 2 in English)
1 Plastic miniature

KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE

213518.description:
Conan, scrambling up, saw the man lying dead with his throat torn out, and a great gray wolf stood over him, head sunk as it smelt the blood that formed a pool on the grass.

...

She called to the wolf and it trotted to her side like a great dog and rubbed its giant shoulder against her knee, while it gazed at Conan with great green lambent eyes. Absently she laid her hand upon its mighty neck, and so the two stood regarding the king of Aquilonia.

...

The great wolf drowsed beside her, facing the fire, his huge head sunk on his paws, his ears twitching in his dreams.

— Robert E. Howard, The Hour of the Dragon

Contains:

6 Tiles (3 in French, 3 in English)
10 Plastic miniatures

KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE
213518.name: Conan: Giant Wolves

213519.name: Conan: Demon of the Earth
213519.description:
But the face was higher than his own, and there was a demoniac aspect about it—Conan had noted various abnormalities about Zogar Sag's features—an obliqueness of the eyes, a sharpness of the ears, a wolfish thinness of the lips: these peculiarities were exaggerated in the apparition which swayed before him. The eyes were red as coals of living fire.

More details came into view: a slender torso, covered with snaky scales, which was yet man-like in shape, with man like arms, from the waist upward, below, long crane-like legs ended in splay, three-toed feet like those of huge bird. Along the monstrous limbs the blue fire fluttered and ran. He saw it as through a glistening mist.

— Robert E. Howard, Beyond the Black River

Contains:

4 Tiles (2 in French, 2 in English)
1 Plastic miniature

KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE

213520.name: Lego Nexo Knights Trading Card Game
boardgameimplementation: Lego Ninjago Trading Card Game: Master of Spinjitzu
213520.description:
Trading Card Game based on the LEGO Nexo Knights franchise. Two players build decks from a card pool of character, action and vehicle cards. Each deck must contain at least 20 cards in the base game or 30 cards in the advanced game. The same card must not be included more than once per deck.

During the game, players alternately placing one character on a playing field containing 3x3 spaces (base game) or 4x4 spaces (advanced game). Character cards feature numerical values on each of the four card edges. After a character is placed next to at least one opponent's character, one or more duels are fought by comparing adjacent numerical values. The character with the higher value wins the duel, and the losing character is turned by 180°, indicating a change of control. Action and vehicle cards provide boosts to character stats or have other effects. The game ends when all spaces of the playing field are filled with a character, and the player who controls the majority of characters wins.

Game is sold in booster packs containing 5 cards.

213523.description:
Description from the publisher:

Feudum: Seals & Sirens is a surreal seafaring expansion of Feudum. This expansion adds 6 whirlpool discs, 1 royal writs and a wooden siren.
213523.name: Feudum: Seals & Sirens

213524.description:
Description from the publisher:'

Feudum: Alter Ego is a clever and customizable deck expansion to play Feudum. The game lets you swap up to 6 of the action cards before the game with alternate cards featuring special abilities. The expansion includes:

36 alternate action cards, 6 per player
1 flying epoch marker
1 rulebook
213524.name: Feudum: Alter Ego

213527.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Poseidon Expansion
213527.description:
Out of the depths he comes; Poseidon, Lord of the Depths, is here to greet you!

The second big expansion is the water to quench the fire of Hephaistos. It allows you to take your Mythic Battles to sea, and fight the legendary sea monsters that lurk along the rugged coasts of the Mediterranean.

This expansion contains a new campaign, new models, a new map, tokens, cards, and more!

213528.name: Dracula 4: The Shadow of the Dragon
213528.description:
Dracula 4: The Shadow of the Dragon is a 2013 point-and-click adventure video game developed by Koalabs Studio for Microsoft Windows, OS X, iOS, and Android. It was published on all systems by Microïds. In 2013 the game was released on GOG.com, and in 2014 was bundled with its sequel, Dracula 5: The Blood Legacy. Later in 2014, the bundle was released on Steam.

The game follows 2000's Dracula: Resurrection and Dracula: The Last Sanctuary, and 2008's Dracula 3: The Path of the Dragon. The plot is unrelated to Resurrection and Last Sanctuary, but is the first of a two-part loose sequel to Path of the Dragon, telling the story of Ellen Cross, an art restorer employed at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. When a precious set of fifteen paintings is lost at sea during a storm, Ellen is called to investigate when one of the supposedly lost paintings is auctioned in Budapest. Her investigation soon brings her into contact with Bram Stoker's great-grandson, a mysterious uncatalogued sixteenth painting, and the legacy of Vlad Tepes. The second part of the story, Dracula 5: The Blood Legacy, was released in November 2013.

Shadow of the Dragon received very little attention in the mainstream gaming press, with limited coverage from professional critics, and what reviews it did receive were negative. Critics were especially disparaging about the length of the game, the linearity of the gameplay, and the implementation of the health system

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dracula_4%3A_The_Shadow_of_the_Dragon Dracula 4: The Shadow of the Dragon]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

213529.name: Dracula 5: The Blood Legacy
213529.description:
Dracula 5: The Blood Legacy is a 2013 point-and-click adventure video game developed by Koalabs Studio for Microsoft Windows, iOS, Android and OS X. It was published on all systems by Microïds. In 2014, the game was released on GOG.com and Steam, bundled with its prequel, Dracula 4: The Shadow of the Dragon.

The game follows 2000's Dracula: Resurrection and Dracula: The Last Sanctuary, 2008's Dracula 3: The Path of the Dragon and 2013's Dracula 4: The Shadow of the Dragon. The plot is unrelated to Resurrection and Last Sanctuary, but is instead the second of a two-part loose sequel to Path of the Dragon, continuing the story of Metropolitan Museum of Art art restorer Ellen Cross and her investigation into a mysterious portrait of Dracula. Ellen's journey leads her from New York to Istanbul to the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone, bringing her into contact with an ancient secret society founded by Vlad Tepes' brother Radu, and placing her in the middle of a 500-year-old conflict between the society and Dracula's followers.

The Blood Legacy received very little attention in the mainstream gaming press, with limited coverage from professional critics, and what reviews it did receive were negative. As with Shadow of the Dragon, the biggest criticism of the game was its length, but critics were also unimpressed with the plot, the graphics, and the identical gameplay to the previous game.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dracula_5%3A_The_Blood_Legacy Dracula 5: The Blood Legacy]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

213531.description:
Description from the publisher:

Beware! Unrest may manifest itself in the worst possible situation. New benefits await the Nations that act quickly. Build the greatest Nation from your unique starting conditions!

Unrest, the first big expansion for Nations: The Dice Game, includes eight new Nations.

Four additional new concepts are included: Green dice - Unrest (which makes dice rolling a bit more challenging), Star rerolls (these respond to dice showing Unrest icons), Bonus tiles (something else to aim for each round), and Pass first tiles (get more benefits). Together with the 36 new Progress cards, the replayability is increased significantly. This expansion is recommended when you are experienced with the base game.

The expansion plus reprint of the base game are in production right now, for planned release in August 2017.
213531.name: Nations: The Dice Game – Unrest

213532.name: Strange Magic: Il Gioco di Ruolo Fantasy Old School
213532.description:
From publisher blurb:

E' tornato il tempo in cui un dungeon era un dungeon ed ogni incontro una minaccia alle vostre fragili vite di avventurieri. Il tempo in cui una torcia era più salvifica di una lama, le tenebre una maledizione e ogni trappola un pericolo mortale. Sfida il tuo destino e onora i canoni dell'Old School con Strange Magic, il gioco di ruolo lightweight studiato per essere appreso e giocato durante la vostra prima sessione.

Il Regolamento Base di Strange Magic comprende: 5 Classi, 3 Razze, Abilità, Incantesimi e una Quest di base immediatamente giocabile. 36 Pagine, bianco e nero, illustrato da Stuart Robertson, disponibile in formato stampa e digitale.

Leggi il regolamento e lancia immediatamente i tuoi personaggi negli oscuri sotterranei dell'Antica accademia e ritrova il perduto Amuleto di Yshnak.


Translation courtesy of Google:

He 's back the time when a dungeon was a dungeon and each encounter a threat to your fragile lives of adventurers. The time when a torch was saving a blade, darkness and a curse each trap deadly danger. Challenge your fate and honors the Old School canons Strange Magic, roleplaying lightweight designed to be learned and played during your first session.

The Regulations of Strange Magic Base includes: 5 classes, 3 races, skills, spells and a basic Quest immediately playable. 36 pages, black and white, illustrated by Stuart Robertson, available in print and digital.

Read the rules soaring up your characters in the dark dungeons of the Ancient Academy and finds the lost amulet Yshnak.

213533.name: Strange Magic Companion
213533.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strange Magic Companion espande il regolamento base di Strange Magic, aggiungendo maggiore profondità di gioco e una migliore progressione dei personaggi. Il Master potrà decidere liberamente cosa aggiungere e come, mantenendo lo spirito essenziale di Strange Magic.

Nuove Classi, Abilità Speciali, Poteri Magici, Artefatti e le regole su come gestire la follia degli esploratori dei dungeon.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Strange Magic Companion expands the basic regulation of Strange Magic, adding greater depth of play and a mig liore character progression . The Master will be able to freely decide what to add and how, while maintaining the essential spirit of Strange Magic.

New Classes, Special Abilities, Magic Powers, Artifacts and rules on how to handle the madness of the dungeon explorers.

213534.name: Creature dei Dungeon: Bestiario Base, Volume 1
213534.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dall'Ape Assassina allo Zombie

Creature dei Dungeon è il bestiario base che vi permetterà di popolare le vostre avventure con mostri di ogni tipo. Di facile consultazione, questa guida vi servirà da riferimento anche per generare nuove creature.
Due brevi appendici aggiungono dei nuovi incantesimi e la possibilità di creare gruppi di esploratori, che potranno contrastare o aiutare i personaggi nelle loro quest.


Translation courtesy of Google:

EPA to Zombie Killer

Dungeons creatures is the basic bestiary that will allow you to populate your adventures with monsters of all kinds. Easy to read, this guide will serve as a reference also to generate new creatures.
Two short appendices add new spells and the ability to create groups of explorers, who will counter or help the characters in their quest.

213535.name: La Rocca Oscura (Strange Magic)
213535.description:
From publisher blurb:

L’ombra oscura della rocca avvolge la montagna. Riuscirai a trovare la via per raggiungere la vetta e salvare gli abitanti del villaggio? Una quest base per Strange Magic in pieno spirito Old School, perfetta per essere giocata immediatamente senza alcuna preparazione da un gruppo di personaggi di 1-3 Livello.


Translation courtesy of Google:

The dark shadow of the fortress surrounds the mountain. Can you find the way to reach the top and save the villagers? A quest basis for Strange Magic in full spirit Old School, perfect to be played immediately without any preparation by a group of 1-3 level characters.

213538.name: The Athar Citadel
213538.description:
A Location in Nowhere

From the introduction:

The Athar Citadel is a stand-alone adventure location for use with your campaign. It is the center of power of the trans-planar organization known as the Athar, whose central tenet is that the gods are unworthy of the worship they demand from mortals.

213539.name: HAWK & MOOR I
213539.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lake Geneva, 1972. Gygax. Arneson. Come experience the Golden Age ...

THE CREATION of the world’s preeminent Fantasy Role-Playing Game (FRPG), Dungeons & Dragons®, is one of the most fascinating tales to be told in all the shared histories of entertainment, play and game design. Two very different men, David Lance Arneson and Ernest Gary Gygax, undertook an unprecedented collaboration which gifted us — as their shared legacy — with one of the most intriguing games the world has yet experienced. Their game did not just simulate one isolate corner of reality; it dared to encompass the entirety of all realms of adventure, the consensual playground of the human imagination.

HAWK & MOOR tells the story of Dave and Gary, and the many other people whose efforts gave first life to the game we know and love today. Arneson had spectacular ideas, but Gygax knew how to refine them. Collaboration soon turned to conflict as Arneson believed his game was being taken from him, and Gygax crystallized systems where incomprehensible riddles had stood before. Both men were creative geniuses, but the game they created from Gygax’s Chainmail (1971) was the end result not only of their teamwork, but also of their clashes and disagreements.

HAWK & MOOR chronicles that first legendary game to arise from the Golden Age of Fantasy Role-Playing. Herein you will find Gary’s life story, the history of Gen Con and the Castle & Crusade Society, and details concerning the conception of Castle Greyhawk. This first book also includes new revelations pertaining to Arneson’s Blackmoor and its influences; tales from the Blackmoor Dungeons and Loch Gloomen; details on Gary’s first dungeon adventure; an exploration of the links between H. P. Lovecraft, Robert E. Howard, and the earliest underworld adventures; the secrets of the asylum which inspired Castle Greyhawk; and much more.

HAWK & MOOR, The Unofficial History of Dungeons & Dragons®, includes 107,300 words on over 470 pages, supported by a detailed chronology, extensive research into the inspirational origins of D&D, and over 490 footnotes and annotations.

The adventure begins here. Prepare yourself, take up torch and sword. Come along and experience an unprecedented journey into the Golden Age!

213540.name: Valdisfjell Market
213540.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Dwarven Hold of Valdisfjell, deep beneath the Old Mountain, has a long and glorious history. The market is famed for the wide range of goods on offer, from fine Dwarven weaponry, ancient maps and books, potions and items from across the Nine Kingdoms.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 20 battlemap depiciting a Dwarven bazaar in the Dwarven Hold of Valdisfjell. Stalls include food, adventuring goods, magic items, potions, weapons and armour, books, jewellery, a small tavern, and more. The map builds with others in the Valdisfjell range to make a large Dwarven Hold.

213541.name: Ghost Punchers: Bare Knuckle Edition
213541.description:
From publisher blurb:


Ghosts Are Real!

Ghosts are the horrific spirits of the evil dead who haunt the living and consume their life force rather than face Final Judgment! These phantom cannibals are invisible, intangible, and only you can stop them!

And They Need to be Punched!

Because you’re a ghost puncher. You’re a psychic with a mission and mean right hook. Not only can you see these sinister specters, but you can touch them — which means you can punch into the Light whether they want to go or not!

Ghost Punchers is a Savage Worlds setting of supernatural investigation and violence packed with

Rules for creating ghosts
Rules for possession, haunting, and such ghostly activities
New Edges, Hindrances, and Powers to help you create the ghost puncher of your dreams
And the obligatory much more!





What are you waiting for?

Grab your dice and get to work! These ghosts won’t punch themselves!

213542.name: Lords of Westmoor
213542.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lords of Westmoor is a sourcebook detailing the most powerful people in the fantasy barony of Westmoor:

Lady Anya Moorland, the hard-eyed, soft-hearted ruler of Westmoor
Lord Corwyn Rowe, Anya's "trophy husband" who's as ambitious as he is attractive
Thaya Grall, captain of the castle guard who will kill or die for honor
Sir Jaeks, the court huntsman who keeps a terrible secret
Father Noonan Wolt, a drunk priest with more than a few secrets of his own




Each of these characters is fleshed out with not only game statistics, but strengths, weaknesses, motivations, and roleplaying notes as well. Together, they form a dramatic web of treachery and ambition ready to capture your players' characters in its strands.

Westmoor is designed to fit seamlessly into any fantasy roleplaying campaign. While its inhabitants are distinct, the setting itself is defined loosely enough that you can slip it into your favorite fantasy world and place it wherever you need it.

If you're looking to add intrigue, conspiracy, and diplomacy to your campaign, you've come to the right place. Step inside Castle Moorland and meet the Lords of Westmoor!

213543.name: Shadow Wolf & Hell Tiger
213543.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the next installment of Monster Mash. Here you will find new creatures and/or new takes on old creatures for your Fantasy Hero Campaign.

This installment will cover a new creature Shadow Wolf & Hell Tiger. Neither of these creatures are natural to this plane. They are either summoned or has some how chanced upon a gate to this realm.

They are both aggressive and dangers creatures to encounter. Both are also used as companions or guardians. Neither should be taken lightly or thought of as simply an animal to be dispensed.

213544.name: Wordoku: Fun Spelled Out
213544.description:
Description from the publisher:

Wordoku is a combination crossword-sudoku word game for one to six players. In the game, players race to create words and earn points using wooden letter tiles on a 4x4 grid, while skillfully incorporating all the tile symbols to double word values! The game is played over three rounds in which players earn awards for scoring the highest number of points -- and for improving their personal high scores between rounds! The player with the most award tokens after three rounds wins! Wordoku is easy to learn but challenging to master - it's Fun Spelled Out!

213545.name: Upload 2016
213545.description:
From publisher blurb:

This collection contains a nookmarked PDF and Hero Designer Files containing the following previously S.I.D.s Report Supplements:

S.I.D.s Report 01 – Russian Siblings
S.I.D.s Report 02 – Vigilantes
S.I.D.s Report 02 – PsiForce
S.I.D.s Report 04 – Shadow Coven
S.I.D.s Report 05 – Aces Of Death
S.I.D.s Report 06 – Purity Knights

213546.name: Akula
213546.description:
From publisher blurb:

He was found by a Russian research vessel and submitted to years of study. Resenting his subjugation, he found a way to escape. While his greatest desire is to be left alone, the Russians have other plans.

Written by Dominique Sumner, with full color art by Joe Singleton, and layout by Walt Robillard. Each volume of Hostile Intent presents an extensively detailed character, or villainous organization, that can be seamlessly integrated into Villains and Vigilantes roleplaying game; from a one-shot adventure to an ongoing campaign.

213547.name: Plastic Peril
213547.description:
From publisher blurb:

BEWARE THE POLYMER THRALLS!

They're relatively cheap, they don't ask questions, and they will get the job done or they will cease their existence in trying. They're Polymer Thralls... artificial humaoid beings made of a single piece of plastic and they can be had for a low, low price!

Nevermind that no one really understands how they walk and talk and think... no, really, never mind. Bad things happen to people who ask too many questions about the Polymer Thralls.

So drop this capsule in some warm water and enjoy your new minion, or dress it up a little, hand it a gun, and watch it go to town on things that you don't like! Just... seriously.... stop asking so many questions.

213548.name: Mind Wreck
213548.description:
Mind Wreck is a strategic, downright sexy board game that will spice up any bedroom. It’s a two-player game that gives special privileges to the winner. As you progress around the board, you’re given sexy tasks. Each task is designed to bring you or your opponent closer to climax. Seduce your way to the winning circle with two ways to win.

Primary way to win: Collect three “win cards”.
Secondary way to win: Drive your opponent to climax.

The win cards are collected by reaching the “g-spot” space on the game board three times. These cards in turn give all-powerful rules that remain in play until a winner is declared.

213549.description:
The raid is over, and the victorious Vikings gather in the chieftain's tent to divide the spoils of war! Piled high on a massive oak table are the best treasures taken during the raid: gleaming gems, shiny swords, fine armor, and magical artifacts! Once strong allies, the Vikings are taken by greed, and soon a heated debate ensues — who will get which spoils? Fists pound the table, insults are made, and tempers rise!

Spoils of War is a fast-paced and exciting game of bidding and wagering for 3-5 players. Each round, players roll their dice, then cleverly bluff and bet to outwit their fellow Vikings. The winners of each round get to claim fantastic treasures to add to their collection! With lots of twists and surprises, no one knows who will win until the last treasure is claimed and the spoils are counted!
213549.name: Spoils of War
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 033 – Great Western Trail vs The Oracle of Delphi

213550.name: Crows Adopt Vulgarity
213550.description: Crows Adopt Vulgarity is sure add color and vulgarity to your next game night. Gameplay is as easy as A-B-C. One player poses a question using a Black Card, and the remaining players respond with their most amusing White Card. See full rules below: Object: Create the most unique, hilarious, and downright crude combinations of black and white cards. Setup: Each player is dealt ten white cards. Gameplay: One player (the judge) flips over a black card. The remaining players place their most hilarious white card facedown in a pile. The judge reads the combinations aloud, and awards the black card to the player with their favorite match. Rotate the judge each round. Winning: After all cards have been played, the player with the most black cards is the winner. Cards Against Humanity is a trademark of Cards Against Humanity LLC and is completely unaffiliated with this game or its publisher.

213551.name: Words Against Morality
213551.description:
Adult party game sure to add color and vulgarity to your next game night. Gameplay is as easy as A-B-C. One player poses a question using a Black Card, and the remaining players respond with their most amusing White Card.

Object: Create the most unique, hilarious, and downright devilish combinations of black and white cards. Setup: Each player is dealt ten white cards.

Gameplay: One player (the judge) flips over a black card. The remaining players place their most hilarious white card facedown in a pile. The judge reads the combinations aloud, and awards the black card to the player with their favorite match. Rotate the judge each round.

Winning: After all cards have been played, the player with the most black cards is the winner.

4-Volume set. Includes 440 cards, 120 Black Cards and 320 White Cards.

213552.name: Way of the Red
213552.description:
Way of the Red is a 2d action platformer with a focus on fun combat, satisfying kills, and fluid movement. Use versatile sword techniques to shred enemies to pieces, while searching for your lost love from years past.

Source: The Game Website.

213553.name: Abduction Bit
213553.description:
Abduction Bit is a NES-like arcade based on elements of some timeless classics from 80's.

Source: The Developer Website.

213554.name: Gunmetal Arcadia Zero
213554.description:
Unrest brews in the city of Arcadia, and a monstrous enemy approaches.

Source: The Game Website.

213555.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Sand Kraken is a massive and terrifying creature to behold! The vast bulk of its form remains underground as it tunnels through the rock and sand, bursting its head out of the ground to lash out with its many snapping and spitting tentacle mouths. This XXL Enemy Pack contains everything you need to have Epic battles with the unspeakably horrifying Sand Kraken and its writhing tentacle mouths! Included is 1 massive Sand Kraken model, the extra large Enemy Record Sheet for it, all of the Threat Cards needed to add it to your games, and a new Mission focusing on hunting down this deadly new Enemy!
213555.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Sand Kraken XXL Enemy Pack

213556.name: RENOIR
213556.description:
User Summary

Renoir is a story-driven puzzle platformer that draws inspiration from classic 1940s film noir.

213557.name: Derelict Generator
213557.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Ancient spaceships drift across the canvass of space. Breach their hulls to find the treasure and stories within.

Derelict Generator is a generic sci-fi supplement that enables you to create random and unique derelict spacecraft to explore, loot and fight through.


Use a unique system where dice position matter
Run low-prep or one-shot sci-fi campaigns

213558.name: Even the Ocean
213558.description:
Even the Ocean is a narrative action platformer about balancing the Light and Dark energies that hold the world together.

Source: The Game Website.

213559.name: Campfire: One of Us Is the Killer
213559.description:
User Summary

You got to bluff, accuse and persuade others via voice chat. It is based on communication and logic. Observe others and their intentions via their vocal expression.

213560.description:
Description from the publisher:

Stalking the swampy jungles of Jargono, the deadly Swamp Raptor is one of the creatures most feared by tribal natives and Serpentmen alike! With its thick-scaled hide, lightning fast speed, and viciously sharp teeth, the Swamp Raptor is the ultimate predator of the jungle! This Enemy Pack contains everything you need to add the savage Swamp Raptor of Jargono to your games of Shadows of Brimstone! A high detail plastic model of the Swamp Raptor is included, as well as the rules and cards needed to add it to your games.
213560.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Swamp Raptor of Jargono XL Enemy Pack

213561.name: Last Days of Spring 2
213561.description:
User Summary

It’s been five years since the Hayabusa Academy gang graduated from high school, Yuka has just graduated from University and moved to a new city when she receives an invitation from Aya, her best friend, for a class reunion in her country lodge in Cannon Beach, Oregon.

213562.description: This is a set of 2 Corpse Pile Miniatures in *Resin*. We have Limited Quantities of these because they are not mass-produced, but hand poured resin by our staff in the FFP studio. They are game miniatures which can replace the Corpse Pile tokens in Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death.
boardgameaccessory: Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death
213562.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Resin Corpse Piles

213563.name: Ohayou! Beginner's Japanese
213563.description:
Have you always been interested in learning Japanese? Asuka and Kenji are here to help guide you along the path to learning how to read Japanese Hiragana and Katakana. Use digital flash cards to learn how to both write and how to pronounce each character.

Source: [http://www.nintendo.com/games/detail/ohayou-beginners-japane...# The Publisher Website].

213564.name: Project Wight
213564.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Project Wight takes place during a fictionalized version of the early Viking era, in which "humans share the world with the last remnant of a forgotten species of intelligent creatures." Players play as and see the world through the eyes of those creatures, battling the humans who have nearly eradicated the race entirely.

213568.description: The Grand Shaman is a more powerful Serpentmen Shaman and is featured in the Serpentmen of Jargono Deluxe Enemy Pack. That set contains all of the rules for the Grand Shaman. Usually players use the normal Serpentmen Shaman to represent the Grand Shaman if he comes into play. Now, you can have a highly detailed specific Grand Shaman enemy model in your games of Shadows of Brimstone!
boardgameaccessory: Shadows of Brimstone: Serpentmen of Jargono Deluxe Enemy Pack
213568.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Resin Special Enemy Grand Shaman

213569.description: Sergeant Bunker is one of Colonel Scafford's trusted Lieutenants and is featured in the Scafford Gang Deluxe Enemy Pack. That set contains all of the rules for the Scafford Lieutenants, including Sergeant Bunker, but usually players just use their Col. Scafford model to represent a Scafford Lieutenant if he comes into play. Now, you can have a specific Sgt. Bunker (or use him to represent any Scafford Lieutenant) enemy model in your games of Shadows of Brimstone!
boardgameaccessory: Shadows of Brimstone: The Scafford Gang Deluxe Enemy Pack
213569.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Resin Special Enemy Sgt. Bunker

213570.description: The Void Magus is a more powerful Void Sorcerer and is featured in the Masters of the Void Deluxe Enemy Pack. That set contains all of the rules for the Void Magus, but usually players just use one of their Void Sorcerers as a Void Magus if he comes into play. Now, you can have a specific Void Magus enemy model in your games of Shadows of Brimstone!
boardgameaccessory: Shadows of Brimstone: Masters of the Void Deluxe Enemy Pack
213570.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Resin Special Enemy Void Magus

rpgseries: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System
213576.name: Ghost Planets
213576.description:
From publisher blurb:

A galaxy full of graves...

In the 23rd century, we found signs of intelligent life in the galaxy — deserted planets full of alien structures. The World Council established the Xenohistory Corps to investigate these ghost planets and determine what happened to their inhabitants.
In the far reaches of the galaxy, your group of Corps explorers and scientists searches the abandoned relics of inhuman beings, looking for answers. You must survive hostile environments, decipher ancient clues, and confront the miraculous and terrifying products of alien technologies. If you fail, Earth may become the next ghost planet.

Forbidden Planet meets Star Trek in this Fate World of Adventure by Don Bisdorf. Ghost Planets requires Fate Core to play. This 55-page supplement includes:

Space-specific rules for aspects and skills, including homeworld aspects, research roles, new skills, and skill packages
New rules to help make research an active and interesting part of your campaign
A team action mechanic to reflect the effects of the crew working together
Plenty of ideas for alien technologies, spaceships, and equipment for characters to use
A variety of deep space locations (and potential threats) to get you started
A starter adventure: The Doomsday Clock




Deciphering alien hieroglyphics, disarming ancient weapons, and saving humanity from extinction. Just another day on the job.

213578.description:
Description from the publisher:

Yōkai Quest is a collaborative board game, heavily based in the classic mechanics of beat’em up games and RPGs. Set in a fantasy, Japan-inspired world, the miniatures included are designed with “chibi” look; this means a cute way of design, with the characters having big and expressive faces.

The players can choose between different heroes: the samurai, a monk, a gunslinger, a priest, and more. Each one of them has a unique set of traits: movement, attack power, abilities, etc. At the beginning of a game, the player will configure the abilities the hero will be able to use during the fight: these abilities will make the hero more defensive, capable of helping other heroes and/or having access to powerful attacks.

The yōkai are the enemies of the game: inspired in the ones from the Japanese folklore, these supernatural beings will follow “behavior cards”, so their acting is managed by the own players. Those will indicate in an easy to follow way what the yōkai will do in each given situation. The yōkai will be constantly spawning from settled points in random amounts, decided by drawing cards from their specific deck.

Heroes and Yōkai take turns to play: they will move, attack and use abilities while fighting in the tiled boards. The gameplay has a staged feeling, represented by the different scenarios. To advance, objectives must be accomplished: eliminate a number of specific enemies, surviving long enough, etc. This goes until the heroes reach the last board, where the final boss of the mission appears. To win the mission, heroes must defeat this powerful enemy.
213578.name: Yōkai Quest
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 033 – Great Western Trail vs The Oracle of Delphi

213581.name: Hidden
213581.description:
From publisher blurb:

A generic cyberpunk / tech-noir science fiction adventure.

Hidden is a small, quick and easy adventure for any game group that wants a fast and simple adventure for a single night.

This is a generic adventure, created for ANY type of science-fiction/cyberpunk/tech-noir setting/world. The adventure is written without any rule system in mind. Most RPG rules based in this type of world should be possible to be used.

In Hidden the adventurers are enlisted to find a missing woman. But after investigating, the group find themselves being hunted by powerful forces...

This is the first in a series of cheap, quick and fun generic adventures by PenguinComics.com. These adventures also work perfectly fine to use with our rule system Drudge!

213582.name: The Beast
213582.description:
From publisher blurb:

A generic fantasy dungeon / hack-and-slash adventure.

The Beast is a small, quick and easy adventure for any game group that wants a fast and simple adventure for a single night.

This is a generic adventure, created for ANY type of fantasy setting/world. The adventure is written without any rule system in mind. Most RPG rules based in this type of world should be possible to be used.

In The Beast the adventurers enters a dungeon with the mission to find a treasure. But as they enter the dungeon, they find themselves trapped - and now they have to fight to survive!

This is the second adventure in a series of cheap, quick and fun generic adventures by PenguinComics.com. These adventures also work perfectly fine to use with our rule system Drudge!

boardgameintegration: Table Air Combat: Bf-109E
Table Air Combat: Bf-109F
Table Air Combat: Bf-109G
Table Air Combat: Bf-110C
Table Air Combat: Bf-109E
Table Air Combat: Bf-109F
Table Air Combat: Bf-109G
Table Air Combat: Bf-110C
213584.description:
The U-2 Kukuruznik (Corn-Cutter) was a small utility biplane used as a trainer, scout, ambulance, and transport. It was also used as a light attack aircraft out of desperation.

This set is a self-contained rulebook that includes miniatures for the U-2 and contains five scenarios: Recon, Cat and Mouse, Siege of Odessa, Nachtexen, Kursk.
213584.name: Table Air Combat: U-2 Kukuruznik

213586.name: Count Khabal
213586.description:
From publisher blurb:

While searching for a dark force to help rescue his family from the Thule Society, Reuven Khabal was approached by the Merlin of Earth. Warning him against using dark magic, the Merlin took Reuven on as an apprentice. Unfortunately, Reuven’s ambition to inflict pain and suffering upon his enemies festered within his heart and soul. Even after the fall of the Axis powers and the ending of the Second World War, Reuven’s desire for vengeance could not be fully sated.

Unable to attain this goal under the Merlin, Reuven eventually sought out, and made a pact with, Lord Orkus -- the King of the Underworld. Using the power given to him by Orkus, Reuven hunteddown Thule sorcerers as Count Khabal (PL 11).

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

213587.name: Conspire
213587.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Designer's blurb:

Control the world, one story at a time

Conspire is a hidden-role storytelling game. Its gameplay is divided into three phases: Genesis (focusing on world-building), Exodus (letting your group act out characters in this world), and Revelation (giving you time for reflection and revision before the next round). Your group determines the pocket universe the game is set in for that session. Everyone creates roles for each other to play in the upcoming story. These character archetypes are privately given goals to achieve. Roles are distributed randomly and secretly. Players then adopt a character befitting their role and try to achieve their goals through diplomacy and storytelling. Since many objectives conflict, players obfuscate their true motives to get others’ support. After the story has concluded, the goals and roles are tweaked to keep things fresh and mysterious and a new round begins.

Aside from storytelling and persuasion, the primary mechanic during the discussion phase is ‘influence’. Every player gets three influence tokens to spend which make anything about the world true. These must not contradict existing facts or remove agency from players, but can still drastically alter reality. The world of Conspire quickly becomes unique, bizarre, and wonderfully twisted.

Think of Conspire as a back-room meeting between powerful Illuminati-style leaders. Everyone has the power to shape the world and control humanity. The powerful and greedy have the opportunity to rise even further, using their wit and words to manipulate the rest of the group. Authority is easy to gain and lose, with victors growing complacent and underdogs striking from the shadows.

213589.name: Death Stalker
213589.description:
From publisher blurb:

Michael Garfield is one of the world's deadliest assassins. He specializes in killing his targets with scorpion venom; earning him the name “Death Stalker.” Eventually, Death Stalker was captured by Recluse and sent to prison. There, he was contacted by the villainous, Kraken, who freed him and put him to work as the Cartel's top assassin.

Iconic Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

213591.description:
2 promo cards for Shadows of Brimstone. Includes 2 artifact cards:


Void Canary
Scorch Pistol


Available when purchasing the Trederra Deluxe Otherworld Expansion direct from Flying Frog, either online, as part of the Kickstarter, or at conventions.
213591.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Trederra Promo Cards

213592.name: Førstemann til mølla
213592.description:
Førstemann til mølla er det nye brettspillet hvor man på realistisk vis reiser rundt i Sør-Norge for å fullføre oppdrag og besøke severdigheter. Alle kjemper om de samme oppdragene, og som i virkeligheten må man bruke både tid og penger for å komme seg rundt. Men det er kun førstemann frem som får prispengene, og det er derfor avgjørende at du velger dine oppdrag med omhu. Haugevis med prispenger er nøkkelen til suksess, ettersom det muliggjør hurtig forflytning og kjøp av de gullbillettene man også må skaffe seg for å vinne spillet.

Dette er brettspillet for deg som er på jakt etter et utfordrende, morsomt og lærerikt spill. Her er det en fordel å forstå seg på strategi, geografi og økonomi. Spillet passer like godt å spille med familien som med vennegjengen!

213593.name: Super Mario Run
videogamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
213593.description:
A new kind of Mario game you can play with one hand. Mario constantly runs forward, while you time your taps to pull off stylish jumps and moves to gather coins and reach the goal!

Source: The Game Website.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC2 - County of Urnst Season Two
213594.name: Stone Road Murders
213594.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Strange murders have been taking place on the Stone Road. Your band of adventurers must find who is responsible before the next victims are claimed.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC2 - County of Urnst Season Two
213595.name: Nimar's Secret
213595.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

This adventure is part four in a continuing series that explores the Crystal Springs, an odd crystal laden area of upwelling waters that begins the Franz River.

An adventure for characters level 3 - 8.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC2 - County of Urnst Season Two
213596.name: Operation Ixworth
213596.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A covert military mission deep into the Empire of Iuz to restore the balance of power and avoid a collapse of the Pact of Greyhawk.

An adventure for characters level 3 - 10.

213597.name: Linda 3
213597.description:
User Summary

The game's story combines psychological elements with voodoo and the occult. The two main characters in the game are Ken, an army soldier tasked with the job of catching monsters; and his girlfriend Linda, who is used by the military as a surrogate for the god's plans.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC2 - County of Urnst Season Two
213598.name: Servant of the Prophet
213598.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The long dormant Fennelmore swamp is stirring. Perhaps the witch of the bog is restless, or has a greater evil awakened?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 10.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC2 - County of Urnst Season Two
213599.name: Over Hill and Dale
213599.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Unknown thieves are harassing caravans plying the Floating Road through Fennelmore Swamp. People are disappearing and cargoes are being plundered. Stout hearts are needed.

An adventure for characters level 3 - 10.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC2 - County of Urnst Season Two
213600.name: Once an Eagle
213600.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Citizens of Bampton are dying in bloody ways and you've been framed.

An adventure for characters level 3 - 10.

213601.description:
The Grid is a colorful board game that creates beautiful patterns as you play it. Based on the rules of the Dominoes, it is a mix between a puzzle and a strategy game that you can play alone or with/against up to 10 friends.

The game consists of 88 hexagonal tiles, each made of three diamond-shaped faces. Visually, each piece looks like a 2D representation of a cube. The tiles are made from six varieties of color, plus some black tiles.

The rules of The Grid Game are simple:


Each player gets a number of tiles, depending on the number of players.
You have to connect tiles by color and height.
In order to play a tile it has to touch two tiles at the same time
There are special black tiles that serve to block further advance; no tile, even another black one, can touch a black tile.


Players take turns placing tiles according to these rules until no one can make another move, first one to use all his/her tiles, wins the game.
213601.name: The Grid Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 155

213602.name: Bed, Wed, Dead: A Game of Dirty Decisions
213602.description:
In Bed, Wed, Dead: A Game of Dirty Decisions, a roll of the dice gives you three names, then the rest is up to you! Will you choose to wed Maid Marian and murder Morgana? How about one night with Jimmy Fallon vs. a lifetime with Jimmy Kimmel? There are no easy choices — only easy laughs as your friends watch you struggle while wagering on what you'll decide.

Featuring three hundred cards in different categories with more than three thousand names PLUS blank cards for you to make the game your own, Bed, Wed, Dead will have your rolling with raucous laughter.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC3 - County of Urnst Season Three
213603.name: Brotherhood of the Oath
213603.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A series of mysterious murders in the ominous village of Hardwyn embroil the heroes in a wicked assassination plot. Bound by a peculiar event in their collective past, the victims are more than they seem. The heroes must discover the sinister secret of the Brotherhood of the Oath and bring the killer to justice!

An adventure for [character levels] 4 - 12.

User summary:

This adventure was distributed as a 55-page PDF scenario, a 6-page color PDF with print-and-play components (maps and tokens), and a 1-page color PDF with a map of Hardwyn.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC3 - County of Urnst Season Three
213604.name: The Mystery of Mystmoor
213604.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The quest for a sword’s enchantment takes the adventurers to a hidden island in the Nyr Dyv. To fulfill their mission and save a courageous band of Wood Elves, the heroes must steal into a troglodyte lair and discover the mysterious source of the creatures’ newfound power!

A Living Greyhawk regional module for [character levels] 2 - 12.

User summary:

This adventure was distributed as a 46-page PDF scenario, a 3-page PDF ("Appendix II") of player handouts, and a 4-page PDF ("Appendix III") of color maps.

The scenario document is noted as "Version 2.0 - Submitted to HQ - Unofficial Copy"

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC3 - County of Urnst Season Three
213605.name: The Truth Lies in Trigol
213605.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The peaceful calm of Trigol has been upset by murder. Who are we kidding? There is no peace in this refugee town but what little there was has now left.

An Adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC3 - County of Urnst Season Three
213606.name: The Eyes of the Beholder
213606.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A celestial event opens a doorway to events that happened long ago. There, past events may end up being retold for good or ill. A puzzling Living Greyhawk adventure set in the County of Urnst.

User summary:

For 2nd - 12th level characters.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC3 - County of Urnst Season Three
213607.name: Women and Children First!
213607.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Pirates are causing havoc, looting along the border of the Nyr Dyv. Now they’ve started abducting women and children! Unfortunately, the Navies of the Nyr Dyv border countries are stretched to their limit. It’s up to you as adventurers to retrieve them! (Along with the looted treasure, of course.)

An adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

User summary:

This scenario used the product code COU instead of the more-typical URC.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC3 - County of Urnst Season Three
213608.name: Flames of Ventnor
213608.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

"The Dungeons of Ventnor..." No other phrase strikes more fear in the hearts of the good citizens of the County of Urnst. Now you've been ordered to wade through legions of infernals (where did they come from?), walk boldly into the dungeon (like you own the place), locate the most dangerous man in the County (just one guy), and bring him back. Yeah... right.

A County of Urnst module for characters level 2 - 12.

Part 9 of the Lordmaker Series.

User summary:

This scenario used the product code COU instead of the more-typical URC.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC3 - County of Urnst Season Three
213609.name: Good Intentions
213609.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Once again, Fate has handed you a mission. A kindly old man who is not what he appears asks for your help. What could be easier? And what is it that saying about “good intentions”?

A County of Urnst regional module for [character levels] 2 - 12.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC3 - County of Urnst Season Three
213610.name: Winds of Change
213610.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The time has come for action not words. A civil war is anything but civil—death and destruction are no less real or devastating. When the sun sets on the burned and barren fields covered with the County's dead, a decision must be made... with whom will you stand when come the Winds of Change?

Part 11 of the Lordmaker Series.

An adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC5 - County of Urnst Season Five
213611.name: A Day Late and a Doggie Short
213611.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Take a coach ride into the countryside of the County of Urnst. An all-expenses-paid trip thru a settled land of farms and ranches, to pick up some livestock and return it to Radigast city.

An introductory adventure for 1st level characters.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC5 - County of Urnst Season Five
213612.name: Playing for Keeps
213612.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Introductory County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The County’s peaceful neighbor has become a dangerous sleeping giant. With the Forces in Defense of the Realm focused on protecting the long border with the Nyrond Imperium, it falls to new (and expendable) adventurers to map a series of abandoned and long-forgotten keeps along the Franz River. Are they worth the effort to refurbish into a defensive barrier?

An Introductory County of Urnst Regional Adventure for first level characters only.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC5 - County of Urnst Season Five
213613.name: They're Only Kobolds!
213613.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Introductory County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The village of Mennan has two problems: Kobolds, and the fact that no one wants to help get rid of them! Can a band of novice adventurers help the residents of Mennan when all the "more experienced" heroes keep telling them, "They're only kobolds"?

A one-round County of Urnst introductory Living Greyhawk scenario for first level characters only.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC5 - County of Urnst Season Five
213614.name: Smooth as Silk
213614.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Introductory County of Urnst Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A silk merchant has found a secret stash and needs some hunters to gather it up before someone else gets their hands on it. He seems to be in a sticky situation, or perhaps this is what he is offering to his bunch of heroes. Will they be smooth operators or will they get stuck in a rut?

An introductory County of Urnst adventure for 1st level characters only.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC6 - County of Urnst Season Six
213615.name: Into the Dreerwode
213615.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Introduction Adventure

From the introduction:

The Dreerwode is one of the County's largest forests, and one of the most mysterious. Many criminals, animals, and other foul beasts call this place home.

This is an introduction wilderness adventure for 1st−level characters only.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC6 - County of Urnst Season Six
213616.name: Fetch
213616.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Adventure set in the County of Urnst

From the introduction:

In the wake of the Contessa’s death, adventuring opportunity abound. When it slams into you, you have to fetch something of great value from someone of great power... That sounds like an adventure to me!

A one−round introductory adventure set in the County of Urnst for beginning characters of 1st level only.

rpgseries: URC - Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventures
URC6 - County of Urnst Season Six
213617.name: Family Ties
213617.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Introductory Adventure set in the County of Urnst

From the introduction:

In the wake of the death of the Contessa, a number of contenders to the throne all push their claims forward. But what is the most important thing? Money, influence, information or friendship?

A two-round regional introductory adventure set in the County of Urnst for first-level characters only.

213619.name: Launch Window (Issue 0.5 - Nov 2016)
213619.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

A NEW ERA IN SCIENCE FICTION GAMING!
Now you can get new material for your science fiction game - no matter what game it is!

Welcome to LAUNCH WINDOW: A monthly digest that features new material for Cepheus Engine, Diaspora, D20, Open D6, and OSR gaming. Stories and articles every month feature new characters, starships, equipment and rules options for your favorite science fiction games. Every system, every item, every issue.
The Gentleman Scoundrel wasn’t much - an elderly wreak of a transport plying the tramp trade off of the Janus Network. But when revolution comes to a frontier colony, The Gent and his crew may be all that stands between freedom and annihilation!

ALSO IN THIS ISSUE:

Down the Rabbithole: An alternate stardrive for your science fiction game

Worst Call-Sign: And you thought your high school nickname was bad…

1D6 Questions With…: Rob Garitta talks Zaonia, Tesla, Ghost Drive and beyond.

213620.name: Volo's Guide to Monsters: An Official Reference for D&D Adventurers League
213620.description:
From the introduction:

All of the races presented in this document are open for D&D Adventurers League play. That’s right, aasimar, orcs, kenku, yuan-ti... all of it. That said, we have some idea about how these new character races fit into our world, and so herein resides a racial story that must be incorporated into the background of your various characters. If this document references a location for your race, that is where you’re from. If it references a specific tribe, that is where you’re from. If it references an outlook, then that is part of your outlook. I think you get the idea.

User summary:

Adapts the new player races from Volo's Guide to Monsters for legal play in D&D Adventurers League games.

213621.name: King's Forge: Glassworks Plus Pack
213621.description:
The Kickstarter campaign for King's Forge: Glassworks included content for King's Forge that wasn't packed inside the retail edition of that item, but was instead packaged with it for Kickstarter backers and sold separately at conventions otherwise.

King's Forge: Glassworks Plus Pack includes all of the "deluxe" content that was originally shipped with King's Forge: Glassworks: 6 apprentice cards (which require the King's Forge: Apprentices expansion), 2 gather cards (Farm and Dungeon), 2 brown "Farm" dice, 12 "Escape the Dungeon" cards, and 24 special Glassworks craft cards that are designed to work with the King's Forge: Queen's Jubilee expansion.

213622.name: Cooler Than You Think
213622.description:
Understanding Live Action Role Playing (LARP)

From the introduction:

Larp stands for Live Action Role Playing, so although it appears as an acronym, it’s a noun in Nordic countries. I don’t think the full phrase is quite clear or accurate. Does this mean that sitting down at a table and rolling dice while playing Dungeons & Dragons is "dead action role playing"?

Publisher's blurb:

This essay attempts to explain the art of live action role playing, or larp. It is written with the layman in mind.

Sections include:


Defining larp as an art form
Strengths and weaknesses of the form
Variations to the form (like the Larp Mixing Desk)
Larp content, styles, and genres

213623.name: Shadows of Esteren Pregenerated Characters Book 0
213623.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Yldiane, Arven, Eoghan, Finn; these are a few of the iconic personalities of the peninsula of Tri-Kazel, whom players can either play as or draw inspiration from to create their own characters. In total, there are 12 of them, each of whom embodies a typical figure of the Shadows of Esteren universe: Magientist, Demorthèn, priest of the Temple, Varigal, warrior, bard...

This version includes 8 new illustrations and compiles all the pregenerated characters from Book 0 Prologue and Book 1 Universe. Additionally, the 6 characters from Book 1 Universe can be used to play the Shadows of Esteren’s official campaign: Dearg.

Enjoy your time in the shadows!

User summary:

Includes six pre-generated player characters, intended for print-and-play use. Each character includes a one-page character sheet and a one-page full-color image, intended for two-sided print.

213624.name: Shadows of Esteren Pregenerated Characters Book 1
213624.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Yldiane, Arven, Eoghan, Finn; these are a few of the iconic personalities of the peninsula of Tri-Kazel, whom players can either play as or draw inspiration from to create their own characters. In total, there are 12 of them, each of whom embodies a typical figure of the Shadows of Esteren universe: Magientist, Demorthèn, priest of the Temple, Varigal, warrior, bard...

This version includes 8 new illustrations and compiles all the pregenerated characters from Book 0 Prologue and Book 1 Universe. Additionally, the 6 characters from Book 1 Universe can be used to play the Shadows of Esteren’s official campaign: Dearg.

Enjoy your time in the shadows!

User summary:

Includes six pre-generated player characters, intended for print-and-play use. Each character includes a one-page character sheet and a one-page full-color image, intended for two-sided print.

213625.name: Sail's End
213625.description:
From the introduction:

Sail’s End is a seedy portside inn situated in the Eldorian city of Darringmoor, however it can easily relocated to any dock or sea side village in your own campaign. This is a regular haunt of the down and out as well as a popular sailor’s bar, where Tall Man, a simple gambling card game is avidly played by the locals. Sail’s End is also the central premises of the local thieves’ guild, currently run by the innkeeper, Darra.

213626.name: The Mundane Items Tables
213626.description:
200 Miscellaneous Discoveries

From the introduction:

Often players will be searching for ‘stuff’ that you have not planned for in your game design. This may be that they are searching the pockets of that enemy they have just sent to a sticky end or they are going through the drawers and cupboards in a long-forgotten derelict. Whatever the situation, the Mundane Items Table is the answer.

213627.name: Player's Concise Eldoria
213627.description:
Quick Reference Guide

From the introduction:

Somewhere in the Void there exists the star that is called Pharys, so named by scholars who dwell upon the second world that circles it. That world is called Enshar, one of six bodies that make their paths about the life-giving sun and the only one that harbors life. It is a green, bountiful place dominated by vast oceans, having only two major land masses, one located in the northern hemisphere and one in the southern hemisphere. The southern continent is called Altarren and the northern landmass is called Eldoria.

213628.name: Ten Market Stalls
213628.description:
Ten Detailed Market Stalls, Ready to Use

From the introduction:

This volume describes all you need in a variety of market stalls and could be used in its entirety, in a small village, or part of the markets of a larger town.
...
This resource is set in the fantasy world of Eldoria and throughout are explanations for setting specific terms. However if you want to use it in your own campaign, the stalls can very easily be changed to suit the world you are playing in.

213629.name: Encyclopedia Eldoria (2nd Ed.)
213629.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Encylopedia Eldoria is a comprehensive campaign setting for a fantasy role playing world, compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. It is a culmination of material created by its author for running campaign games and tournaments over a thirty year period. It contains information on mythology, history, geography and culture, providing GMs with the perfect background for their players’ adventures.

The Encyclopedia Eldoria contains all the core source material that you need to start a role-playing campaign based in the fantasy realm of Eldoria. It has been written to be easily used in conjunction with most role playing resources and material currently available; the contents being largely descriptive in nature, rather than being rules heavy. You can use Eldoria as presented, tweak the content for your own style of game or use ideas and concepts in the book to enhance your own campaign setting.

This is the second edition and includes revised art-work and new and expanded material, including more varieties of the strange crystal Averaach; information on how magic works in Eldoria; and details of Tas Stones, ancient monuments that allow adventurers to instantly travel long distances.

213630.name: Rat's Nest
213630.description:
Ever wonder what was in that derelict tower on the hill?

Publisher's blurb:

Gimble and his local band of thieves are running from the local thieves’ guild who have taken ownership of an abandoned tower.

This module is a standalone module that could be simply a diversion or further developed as a sub-plot for a larger campaign. Although it is suitable for level 1-2, it could be easily scaled upward in levels, to suit games of higher levels. It also includes hooks to weave into your own game.

213631.name: Unlimited Fugo (アンリミテッド富豪)
213631.description:
The players try to "go-out" by playing all cards in their hand.

Mainly the rule is similar with "Big 2" or "President and Asshole" and so on. It's based on "Daifugo" from Japanese popular card game of playing cards.

In the turn, the player plays a single card for a single card, a pair with two cards for a pair two cards, three for three.

However, in this game, as the player takes chips, the number of the card is added.

Thus, the winner is the ﬁrst player going out.

213632.name: The Hold of the Lich Lord (5e)
213632.description:
From the introduction:

Jaef the Dark used to be the power behind the ancient throne of Kale many centuries ago. He was slain but lived on in his phylactery until he was able centuries later to find a new body and rise again, taking on the anagrammatic name of Afej the Black. He then used his vast intelligence to seize one of the towns of Kelerak and raise an orcish army to gain control of a substantial portion of the kingdom. It is the lich's goal to rule the entire kingdom, and perhaps an empire. Enter the heroes.

User summary:

For 17th - 18th level characters.

213633.description:
In King of the Creepies, up to six players try to build their ultimate teams by collecting creepie cards and outfitting them with gear and special abilities to fight in fast-paced battles. Players bet their hard-earned monies in the hope of buying the perfect cards to crush their enemies, but goblins are always hiding just out of sight to cause all sorts of mischief! Bet, bribe, and battle your way through the marketplace and the arena to become the King of the Creepies!

Each round of the game is played in three phases. In the market phase, players buy and sell cards to try to assemble a team of well-equipped creepies. In the match phase, players reveal their chosen combatants, then bet their monies on the outcome; after bets have been placed, a mischief card is drawn, which affects the battle in an unpredictable way. The battle phase is where the majority of the game takes place. Players battle each other using one of thirty unique creepies, using gear, items, and special abilities to help their cause. The winner earns a victory crystal, and whoever collects five crystals first wins!

The game includes a variant ruleset for "poker mode". In this version of the game, players draw an entirely new hand each round and go through a series of rounds of betting before battle, with the combat winner gaining the pot. Players then draw a whole new hand and try again until one player has all the monies!
213633.name: King of the Creepies

213634.description:
Description from the publisher:

A realistic tactical simulation of naval combat in the 1970s, for two players.

This game represents a combat between two fleets in a group of small islands. It can be treated as a real battle, or as an exercise where opposing sides (Blue and Red) fight for supremacy.

This is one of our games with our original Triangle system. Each piece represent one ship, boat, helicopter... The movement mechanic is simple and very realistic for various types of vehicles, vessels, crafts and different kinds of weapons (guns, missiles, torpedoes...). The system is flexible and allows easy and precise positioning and determination of distance. The board is covered with a net of equilateral triangles. The vertices are points where pieces are positioned, while lines determine direction of the piece or marker.
213634.name: Naval Battle in Archipelago

213636.name: The Effortless Masterpieces
213636.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can’t get enough of popular Pathfinder system? Neither can we… that’s why D3 Adventures has started the Campaign Toybox… monthly releases of new rules, classes, and creatures to enhance your gaming experience, all priced to be friendly to your wallet at a mere ninety-nine cents, so you can afford to stock up on munchies and more dice for your next gaming session!

These simple songs call forth powers, dance, and optical illusions from distant planes. They can cause powerful acts and abilities that test the limit of the Bard’s knowledge.
